attrs.description: The entire chart can now act as a hotspot. Use this Url to define the hotspot link for the chart. The link can be specified in FusionCharts Link format.
attrs.name: clickURL

attrs.description: This attribute allows you to show or hide the icon representing the mean value of the set of data provided.
attrs.name: showMean

attrs.description: This attribute allows you to draw a line connecting all the mean icons of multiple set of data.
attrs.name: drawMeanConnector

description: These attributes let you control a variety of functional elements on the chart. For example, you can opt to show or hide data labels, data values. You can also set chart limits and extended properties.

attrs.description: Caption of the chart.
attrs.name: caption

attrs.description: Sub-caption of the chart.
attrs.name: subCaption

attrs.description: X-axis title of the chart.
attrs.name: xAxisName

attrs.description: Y-axis title of the chart.
attrs.name: yAxisName

description: Using these attributes, you can set the various headings and titles of chart like caption, sub-caption, x-axis and y-axis names etc.

attrs.description: Whether to show legend on the chart.
attrs.name: showLegend

attrs.description: Whether legend keys should be displayed in bold
attrs.name: legendItemFontBold

attrs.description: Sets legend item font
attrs.name: legendItemFont

attrs.description: Sets legend item font size
attrs.name: legendItemFontSize

attrs.description: The legend can be plotted at two positions on the chart - below (BOTTOM) the chart and to the right (RIGHT) of the chart.
attrs.name: legendPosition

description: In box and whisker chart, the series name of each data-set shows up in the legend of the chart. If you do not need the legend, you can opt to hide the same. Also, the legend can be placed at the bottom of the chart or to the right of the chart. Using the attributes below, you can configure the functional and cosmetic properties of the legend.

attrs.description: This configuration determines whether the numbers displayed on the chart will be formatted using commas, e.g., 40,000 if 'formatNumber': '1'; and 40000 if 'formatNumber': '0';.
attrs.name: formatNumber

attrs.description: Configuration whether to add K (thousands) and M (millions) to a number after truncating and rounding it - e.g., if `formatNumberScale` is set to 1, 1043 would become 1.04K (with decimals set to 2 places). Same with numbers in millions - an M will be added at the end.
attrs.name: formatNumberScale

attrs.description: Using this attribute, you could add prefix to all the numbers visible on the graph. For example, to represent all dollars figure on the chart, you could specify this attribute to $ to show like $40000, $50000.
attrs.name: numberPrefix

attrs.description: Using this attribute, you could add a suffix to all the numbers visible on the graph. For example, to represent all figures quantified as per annum on the chart, you could specify this attribute to '/a' to show like 40000/a, 50000/a.
attrs.name: numberSuffix

attrs.description: This attribute helps you specify the character to be used as the thousands separator in a number.
attrs.name: thousandSeparator

attrs.description: This option helps you specify the position of the thousand separator.
attrs.name: thousandSeparatorPosition

attrs.description: Number of decimal places to which all numbers on the chart would be rounded to.
attrs.name: decimals

attrs.description: Whether to add 0 padding at the end of decimal numbers. For example, If you limit the maximum number of decimal digits to 2, a number like 55.345 will be rounded to 55.34. This does not mean that all numbers will be displayed with a fixed number of decimal places. For instance 55 will not be displayed as 55.00 and 55.1 will not become 55.10. In order to have fixed number of decimal places attached to all the numbers, set this attribute to 1.
attrs.name: forceDecimals

description: PowerCharts XT offers you a lot of options to format your numbers on the chart. Using the attributes below, you can control a myriad of options like: Formatting of commas and decimals Number prefixes and suffixes Decimal places to which the numbers would round to Scaling of numbers based on a user defined scale Custom number input formats

attrs.description: Numerical value for the data item. This value would be plotted on the chart.
attrs.name: value

attrs.description: You can individually opt to show or hide values of individual data items using this attribute. This value over-rides the data-set level value.
attrs.name: showValue
